key_points: Facebook is removing content containing the phrase 'stop the steal', a rallying cry of Donald Trump supporters alleging voter fraud in the 2020 elections.
Posts using 'stop the steal' to condemn the movement or discuss it neutrally will be allowed.
The move comes after the January 6 storming of the Capitol by Trump supporters.
Social media platforms, including Facebook, have suspended Trump's accounts and are enforcing stricter misinformation policies.
Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook's COO, stated Trump's account is suspended until at least the inauguration, emphasizing that no one is above Facebook's policies.
Twitter permanently banned President Trump and continues to ban political advertising in the US, including ads paid for by Trump or his allies.
Other platforms such as Reddit, YouTube, Pinterest, and TikTok, have also taken actions against Trump.
Peloton announced a ban on the hashtag #stopthesteal.
Parler, a platform sympathetic to Trump, was suspended by Amazon from its hosting service and removed from Apple and Google app stores.
Twitter removed 70,000 QAnon-related accounts and increased enforcement of policies against incitement of violence and spreading of misleading information.
